gmd:hierarchyLevelName.gco:CharacterString: Highest level of data collection, from a common set of sensors or instrumentation, usually within the same research project

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic Information - Metadata - Part 2: Extensions for Imagery and Gridded Data

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: BCO-DMO EPZT Master Events File from the U.S. GEOTRACES EPZT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: BCO-DMO-created "master" file of sampling events from the GEOTRACES EPZT cruise. Dataset Description: <p>BCO-DMO-created "master" file of sampling events from the GEOTRACES EPZT cruise. This dataset combines information from the EPZT <a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/dataset/502618">event log</a>, bottle files (<a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/dataset/503145">ODF</a> and <a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/dataset/503133">GT-C</a>), and sampling logs.</p> Acquisition Description: <p>BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters:<br />cruise_id, EXPOCODE,SECT_ID, STNNBR, CASTNO, GEOTRC_EVENTNO, GEOTRC_SAMPNO, GEOTRC_INSTR, SAMPNO, GF_NO, BTLNBR, BTLNBR_FLAG_W, DATE_START_EVENT, TIME_START_EVENT, ISO_DATETIME_UTC_START_EVENT, EVENT_LAT, EVENT_LON, DEPTH_MIN, DEPTH_MAX, &nbsp;BTL_DATE, BTL_TIME, BTL_ISO_DATETIME_UTC, BTL_LAT, BTL_LON, ODF_CTDPRS, SMDEPTH, FMDEPTH, BTMDEPTH, CTDPRS, CTDDEPTH.</p><p>Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle and ODF_Bottle datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the TN303 Event Log (version 30 Oct 2014). Where applicable, pump information was taken from the PUMP_Nuts_Sals dataset.</p>

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Department of Biological Sciences Trousdale Parkway AHF-107E

gmd:keyword.gmx:Anchor: Eastern Tropical Pacific - Transect from Peru to Tahiti

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

EPZT = GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect; EXTRA = additional non-GEOTRACES samples taken on the cruise. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650141.rdf Name: STNNBR Units: unitless Description: Station number http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650142.rdf Name: CASTNO Units: unitless Description: Cast number http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650143.rdf Name: GEOTRC_EVENTNO Units: unitless Description: GEOTRACES event number http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650144.rdf Name: GEOTRC_SAMPNO Units: unitless Description: Unique GEOTRACES sample number http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650145.rdf Name: GEOTRC_INSTR Units: unitless Description: Sampling instrument http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650146.rdf Name: SAMPNO Units: unitless Description: Sequential sample number within the cast (usually corresponds to bottle number). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650147.rdf Name: GFISH_NO Units: unitless Description: GeoFish tow number. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650148.rdf Name: BTLNBR Units: unitless Description: Bottle number; typically 1-24. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650149.rdf Name: BTLNBR_FLAG_W Units: unitless Description: Bottle number quality flag; follows WOCE conventions. 2 = good; 3 = questionable; 4 = bad; 9 = missing data. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650150.rdf Name: DATE_START_EVENT Units: yyyymmdd Description: Date (year, month, day) at the start of the sampling event, according to the event log. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650151.rdf Name: TIME_START_EVENT Units: HHMM Description: Time (hours and minutes) at the start of the sampling event, according to the event log; 24-hour clock. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650152.rdf Name: ISO_DATETIME_UTC_START_EVENT Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z Description: Date and time, formatted to the ISO 8601 standard, at the start of the sampling event, according to the event log. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650153.rdf Name: EVENT_LAT Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude at the start of the event; north is positive. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650154.rdf Name: EVENT_LON Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude at the start of the event; east is positive. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650155.rdf Name: DEPTH_MIN Units: meters Description: Minimum depth of the cast. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650156.rdf Name: DEPTH_MAX Units: meters Description: Maxiumum depth of the cast. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650157.rdf Name: BTL_DATE Units: yyyymmdd Description: Date (year, month, day) when the bottle was fired; according to the bottle file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650158.rdf Name: BTL_TIME Units: HHMM Description: Time (hours and minutes) when the bottle was fired; according to the bottle file. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650159.rdf Name: BTL_ISO_DATETIME_UTC Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z Description: Date and time, formatted to the ISO 8601 standard, at the time of bottle firing. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650160.rdf Name: BTL_LAT Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude of bottle firing; north is positive. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650161.rdf Name: BTL_LON Units: decimal degrees Description: Lonitude of bottle firing; east is positive. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650162.rdf Name: ODF_CTDPRS Units: decibars Description: The ODF software acquisition measurement of pressure http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650163.rdf Name: SMDEPTH Units: meters Description: Saunders-Mantyla depth (integrated; uses dynamic height) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650164.rdf Name: FMDEPTH Units: meters Description: Fofonoff-Millard depth (non-integrated; also used by SBE) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650165.rdf Name: BTMDEPTH Units: meters Description: Bottom depth http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650166.rdf Name: CTDPRS Units: decibars Description: CTD pressure http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/650167.rdf Name: CTDDEPTH Units: meters Description: CTD bottle firing depth

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Cruise identification; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: Cruise EXPO code.; General Description: Used as a unique identifier for a cruise. Usual generation formula is ICES 4 character platform code then the cruise departure date in YYYYMDD format. An underscore character may also be present.

PI-supplied Description: Cruise section identifier; EPZT = GEOTRACES East Pacific Zonal Transect; EXTRA = additional non-GEOTRACES samples taken on the cruise.; General Description: Identifier for a segment of a leg of a cruise, where a leg may have been broken into parts.
PI-supplied Description: Station number; General Description: consecutive station number
PI-supplied Description: Cast number; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES event number; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Unique GEOTRACES sample number; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
PI-supplied Description: Sampling instrument; General Description: instrument used to collect or process data, definition is specific to the data set in which it appears

PI-supplied Description: Sequential sample number within the cast (usually corresponds to bottle number).; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle
PI-supplied Description: GeoFish tow number.; General Description: tow number/identification; applies to all towed vehicles and is generally associated with plankton net tows
PI-supplied Description: Bottle number; typically 1-24.; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: Bottle number quality flag; follows WOCE conventions. 2 = good; 3 = questionable; 4 = bad; 9 = missing data.; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details

PI-supplied Description: Date (year, month, day) at the start of the sampling event, according to the event log.; General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

PI-supplied Description: Time (hours and minutes) at the start of the sampling event, according to the event log; 24-hour clock.; General Description: Time GMT defined as HHMM; time of day; generally reported in GMT as HHMM (hours and minutes) but may also be HH.H (decimal hours) or HHMMSS (hours; minutes and seconds); in EqPac time is reported as Hawaii local time NERC Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time, formatted to the ISO 8601 standard, at the start of the sampling event, according to the event log.; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Latitude at the start of the event; north is positive.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude at the start of the event; east is positive.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: Minimum depth of the cast.; General Description: minimum depth sampled
PI-supplied Description: Maxiumum depth of the cast.; General Description: maximum depth sampled

PI-supplied Description: Date (year, month, day) when the bottle was fired; according to the bottle file.; General Description: date; generally reported in GMT as YYYYMMDD (year; month; day); also as MMDD (month; day); EqPac dates are local Hawaii time NERC Description: Unavailable

PI-supplied Description: Time (hours and minutes) when the bottle was fired; according to the bottle file.; General Description: Time GMT defined as HHMM; time of day; generally reported in GMT as HHMM (hours and minutes) but may also be HH.H (decimal hours) or HHMMSS (hours; minutes and seconds); in EqPac time is reported as Hawaii local time NERC Description: Time elapsed between 00:00 UT on the date of the event of interest and that event.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time, formatted to the ISO 8601 standard, at the time of bottle firing.; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Latitude of bottle firing; north is positive.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Lonitude of bottle firing; east is positive.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: The ODF software acquisition measurement of pressure; General Description: water pressure at measurement; depth reported as pressure; positive number increasing with water depth NERC Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column.

PI-supplied Description: Saunders-Mantyla depth (integrated; uses dynamic height); General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Fofonoff-Millard depth (non-integrated; also used by SBE); General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.
PI-supplied Description: Bottom depth; General Description: bottom depth

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: CTD pressure; General Description: water pressure at measurement; depth reported as pressure; positive number increasing with water depth NERC Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column.

PI-supplied Description: CTD bottle firing depth; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters:<br />cruise_id, EXPOCODE,SECT_ID, STNNBR, CASTNO, GEOTRC_EVENTNO, GEOTRC_SAMPNO, GEOTRC_INSTR, SAMPNO, GF_NO, BTLNBR, BTLNBR_FLAG_W, DATE_START_EVENT, TIME_START_EVENT, ISO_DATETIME_UTC_START_EVENT, EVENT_LAT, EVENT_LON, DEPTH_MIN, DEPTH_MAX, &nbsp;BTL_DATE, BTL_TIME, BTL_ISO_DATETIME_UTC, BTL_LAT, BTL_LON, ODF_CTDPRS, SMDEPTH, FMDEPTH, BTMDEPTH, CTDPRS, CTDDEPTH.</p><p>Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle and ODF_Bottle datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the TN303 Event Log (version 30 Oct 2014). Where applicable, pump information was taken from the PUMP_Nuts_Sals dataset.</p>
